description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if official information released by Nexo (nexo.io), official representatives of Nexo (e.g. lawyers, spokespeople, etc.), or a consensus of credible reporting announces by Dec 31, 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET that Nexo is insolvent or is filing/has filed for any variety of bankruptcy (even if they have not yet filed for bankruptcy).

This market will also resolve to "Yes" if Nexo withdrawals for USDC, BTC, ETH and/or SOL are suspended for a majority of users for at least 7 full days in a row by Dec 31, 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this settlement criterion will be official information released by Nexo, official representatives of Nexo (e.g. lawyers, spokespeople, etc.), and a consensus of credible reporting.

If neither of the above criteria are met and a "Yes" resolution is not produced within this market's timeframe, this market will resolve to "No".

Nexo withdrawals being suspended for a majority of users means that a majority users are unable to withdraw their USDC, BTC, ETH, and/or SOL from Nexo. 

If Nexo suspends withdrawals on a day in the last week of December (e.g Nexo halts token withdrawals on December 30, 2022, 4 PM ET), this market will not resolve until either: 1) withdrawals are reenabled before 7 full days pass, resulting in a "No" resolution; 2) 7 full days pass (Dec 30 - Jan 6, 2022, 4 PM ET) where withdrawals are suspended, resulting in a "Yes" resolution.

events.title: Will Nexo become insolvent by EOY?

question: Will Nexo become insolvent by EOY?
